main event: A star-like yellow object was observed in the sky in St. Louis, Missouri on 27 October 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as silver-dollar in size,The sighting lasted for one minute,The weather was clear and the light conditions were dark during the sighting,An air traffic control radar report contained details of the object's duration, flight path, and altitude,The conclusion of the report suggested it was probably an aircraft.
witness description: civilian, instructor at Washington University, Physics Department
